com.ibm.team.workitem.client

Class WorkItemOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.team.workitem.client.WorkItemOperation

  • public abstract class WorkItemOperation
extends java.lang.Object
    A work item operation initializes new or changes existing work items. This is the base implementation which manages the work item working copy's connection and saves the changes on the server on completion.

    Clients instantiate a concrete subclass and invoke it using one of the 'run' methods. Subclasses overwrite execute(WorkItemWorkingCopy, IProgressMonitor) to set attributes on the work item.

    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    WorkItemWorkingCopy, ItemProfile, IWorkItemCommon.findWorkItemType(IProjectAreaHandle, String, IProgressMonitor)

      Only valid for creation where the work item has a full profile.
      WorkItemOperation(java.lang.String name, ItemProfile profile)
      Operations for changing existing work items call this constructor with the item profile they require.

      • WorkItemOperation

        public WorkItemOperation(java.lang.String name)
        Only valid for creation where the work item has a full profile. Use WorkItemOperation(String, ItemProfile) for modifying existing items.
        Parameters:
        name - the operation name

      • WorkItemOperation

        public WorkItemOperation(java.lang.String name,
                 ItemProfile profile)
        Operations for changing existing work items call this constructor with the item profile they require.
        Parameters:
        name - the operation name
        profile - the required item profile for the operation

      • execute

        protected void execute(WorkItemWorkingCopy[] workingCopies,
           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Executes this operation on the given working copies. Subclasses may choose to overwrite this method instead of execute(WorkItemWorkingCopy, IProgressMonitor).
        Parameters:
        workingCopies - the working copies to execute the operation on
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong

      • commit

        protected void commit(WorkItemWorkingCopy[] workingCopies,
          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Commits the operation for the given working copies. This implementation saves the working copies in the repository, subclasses may overwrite.
        Parameters:
        workingCopies - the working copies to commit
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
